there are ripple effects that change society um
the next sort of historical period of studies particularly sort of organizational studies about technology

constructionists so they say actually you know technology doesn't just happen to society we make
technology and it's society and social structures that provide us with an interpretive
framework for understanding what a technology might be for us and it's not purely about its
intrinsic properties it's about how it gets used and as we all go about organizational life
social life cultural life we are creating meaning for the
for for the artifacts the technologies for the things that we do the things the things that are around us so
that seems like a um a slightly more satisfying position than the technological determinism it
gives us as human beings a little bit more of a role but in some ways it's sort of a swing of
the pendulum a little too far in the other direction which somehow or at least in its more um
in in some forms seems to uh evacuate
the technology of any kind of intrinsic properties we stop thinking about the constraints of the technology because
it's somehow all socially constructed so when people have over the last couple of years been arguing for a position on
technological on social and cultural analysis of technology that take that that's broadly called social
material or social materiality what they want to point to is the idea
that um that as things are social they are also material that as
um as social factors shape our experience so too do the material physical
characteristics of technologies spaces places um the things the things that we use
and so we need perhaps a new kind of theoretical frame a social material frame

implied by the production of the figure and then by reconfiguring we mean that you never get to do that just once but
it's an ongoing thing i build a model of the world and then i continually look at the world through that model and i have to adjust the
